p: 17. Discourse lets something be seen. In its primary sense “discourse” (λόγoς as saying-something-about-something) means “letting something be seen.” When it is fully concrete, discourse has the character of speaking or vocalizing in words (φωνή), indeed φωνὴ μετὰ φαντασίας (De anima II 8, 420b32): a vocalization that lets something be seen.
